title: Teen who accidentally shot mother now faces charges
content:
FULTON COUNTY, GA (CBS46) -
A 13-year-old boy who accidentally shot his mother in the neck and throat Saturday night is now charged with aggravated assault and possession of a firearm. It happened inside the family's home on Hilltop Way in College Park.
Fulton County police are investigating and say they still haven't determined exactly how the teen got his hands on a loaded firearm. He told police and his older brother that he found outside in the neighborhood.
“That’s as far as I know. He told me he found it in the subdivision," said Malik Touray, 20, about his younger brother. He added that he believed his brother thought is was "just a toy."
Police said when the teen pulled the trigger, it fired and hit his mother in the neck. They are still trying to determine who owns the gun and who put a bullet in the chamber.
“It is possible for a real gun to look fake. It’s also very possible for a fake or toy gun to look real," said Detective Melissa Parker.
Parker said it appears the shooting was an accident, but the investigation isn't over yet. Due to her injuries, the boy's mother has been unable to speak with investigators.
This is the second time a shooting has occurred at this address in the past 15 months. In September of 2014, police found a 45-year-old man shot to death in the driveway.
Investigators said Hardy Touray owned two local gas stations and robbery may have been a motive for that shooting. Touray was the uncle of the teen now accused of shooting his mother.
